author: Danielle B
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

Just when you think the UK has already reached the lowest of lows, another day rolls by, and more people have been slapped on the wrist, to put it lightly, for terrible crimes.

Members of a family of burglars stole more than £1.2m worth of goods. Newcastle Crown Court has ordered each one of them to pay back £1 ($1.33 American). And no, this is not satire.

British judge fines migrant family £1 each for stealing £1.
title: Migrants steal over a million from people's homes, judge orders them to pay back... a little more than a dollar

author: Danielle B
description:

NEW: Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro starts singing 1988 hit song 'Don't Worry Be Happy' at a rally as the U.S. seized an oil tanker off Venezuela's coast.

"To American citizens who are against the war, I respond ... Don't worry, be happy," he said in Spanish before singing.

"Not… pic.twitter.com/Dt9tYRXTDI
— Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) December 11, 2025
title: Maduro responds to America seizing one of his oil tankers by... belting out a classic 80s pop song

author: Danielle B
description:
Watch Louder with Crowder every weekday at 11:00 AM Eastern, only on Rumble Premium!

One may argue that Seattle is one of the most liberal cities in the country. This may or may not be why they decided to make the FIFA World Cup theme Pride, as it falls in June. The only problem with that, you ask? Well, the two countries competing next year, Iran and Egypt, don't take too kindly when it comes to all things pride. In fact, it’s not what you would call “legal” to celebrate one's prideful behavior in those places. Funny how those things work out.
title: World Cup announces 'Pride' themed match between two anti-LGBTQ foreign countries, and those countries want it changed
